requirements.summary: Create and apply a coherent, student-friendly visual theme across the site (non-blue/purple primary palette).
acceptanceCriteria: All pages share a consistent theme (typography scale, color tokens, button styles, card styles).
Primary/brand color scheme is not blue+purple.

file_operations.description: Define global theme tokens (CSS variables used by Tailwind/shadcn-ui), typography scale, spacing, and base element styles using a warm, student-friendly palette (avoid blue/purple as primary). Ensure styles apply consistently across the app.
Tune Tailwind theme usage to align with the site tokens (container/typography defaults as needed) so pages/components consistently use the same design system.

Create a shared layout wrapper that applies consistent page width, padding, header/footer spacing, and background styling for all views. Use shadcn-ui layout-friendly primitives where appropriate; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Implement a simple landing page that lists the free ebook “Honeydew” with a prominent action to open/read it.
acceptanceCriteria: Landing page displays the ebook title “Honeydew”.
A clear “Read now” (or equivalent) action navigates to an ebook reading view.
UI is responsive and usable on mobile and desktop.

file_operations.description: Build the landing page UI for Class 8 students that displays the generated logo + hero illustration and renders the ebook list (initially Honeydew) with a prominent “Read now” action. Use shadcn-ui components (e.g., Button/Card) for consistent UI; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Add top-level app composition and route wiring so the landing page is reachable as the default view and navigation to the reader view is supported (no login required).

Create a reusable, responsive book listing card component showing title and a clear primary action to read. Compose shadcn-ui components for consistent visuals; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Add an in-browser ebook reading view for “Honeydew” with optional download, without requiring login.
acceptanceCriteria: The Honeydew ebook can be opened in an in-browser viewer (e.g., embedded PDF view).
A visible download link/button is available.
No authentication is required to access the reader or download.

file_operations.description: Implement the ebook reader view that embeds the PDF in-browser (e.g., iframe/object) and includes a clear download button/link using the catalog-provided assetPath. Compose shadcn-ui components for actions and layout; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Wire the reader view into navigation/routing and ensure it is publicly accessible (no auth gating) and reachable from the landing page action.

requirements.summary: Fetch and render a minimal ebook catalog from the backend interface and use the returned asset path/URL to open the reader.
acceptanceCriteria: Backend exposes a query method that returns a list containing an entry for “Honeydew”.
Frontend fetches the ebook catalog and renders it on the landing page.
The reader view uses the catalog entry’s asset path/URL to open the Honeydew ebook.

file_operations.description: Create a small frontend wrapper to access the existing backend actor and call getBooks() using the project's core-infrastructure backend connection configuration. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing (core-infrastructure).
Add a React hook to fetch the book catalog (getBooks) and expose loading/error states for UI rendering (integrate with the existing React Query setup).
Fetch the catalog via useBooks(), render the returned book list, and ensure the “Read now” action navigates using the selected book’s assetPath.
Resolve the requested book from the catalog (by title or a simple route param) and open the embedded PDF using the catalog entry’s assetPath; keep the view accessible without authentication.

requirements.summary: Add the Honeydew PDF as a static public asset and ensure the catalog points to a stable path with a single swap step for the real file.
acceptanceCriteria: A PDF exists under frontend/public and is accessible via the browser at a stable path.
The app’s “Honeydew” entry points to that stable path.
If a placeholder is used, there is one obvious replacement step (swap the PDF file, keep filename the same) and the app continues to work.

file_operations.description: Add a placeholder Honeydew PDF at a stable public path. Document (in a short comment/README note near where the path is referenced) that replacing this single file with the real PDF (same filename) requires no code changes.
Define the stable public asset path string for the Honeydew PDF (e.g., used as a fallback or for local verification) so there is a single obvious place to confirm/adjust the filename if needed.
Ensure the reader embed and download action use the stable assetPath supplied by the catalog (and optionally fall back to the constant) so the same filename swap continues to work.

requirements.summary: Include generated static brand assets (logo + hero illustration) and render them on the landing page as static frontend assets.
acceptanceCriteria: Generated images are stored under frontend/public/assets/generated.
Landing page displays the generated logo and hero illustration.
No backend routes/methods are used to deliver these images.

file_operations.description: Add the generated logo image asset as a static file at frontend/public/assets/generated/honeydew-logo.dim_512x512.png.
Add the generated hero illustration asset as a static file at frontend/public/assets/generated/honeydew-hero.dim_1600x900.png.

Render the static brand assets from frontend/public/assets/generated/honeydew-logo.dim_512x512.png and frontend/public/assets/generated/honeydew-hero.dim_1600x900.png in the landing page UI (served as static frontend assets, not via backend).
